speaker: Arena
lines: Sand remembers names better than gravestones; it just doesn't write them.
The sun sits in the cheap seats; clouds heckle.
A rack of practice weapons leans against a wall that pretends to be stone.
A water barrel watches you like a friend who knows how fights end.
Chalk circles stain the ground where 'next time' was invented.
The tunnel smells of iron and applause.
A girl sells luck ties; the luck is your knot.
The bell pulls the day into pieces the crowd can swallow.
